title: Using optimization fuel during compiler bootstrap results in ICE

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Running `RUSTFLAGS="-Z fuel=rustc=0" ./x.py build` results in an ICE:

```
thread 'main' panicked at 'nonscalar layout for layout_scalar_valid_range type hir::def_id::CrateId: LayoutDetails {
    variants: Single {
        index: 0
    },
    fields: Arbitrary {
        offsets: [
            Size {
                raw: 0
            }
        ],
        memory_index: [
            0
        ]
    },
    abi: Aggregate {
        sized: true
    },
    align: Align {
        abi_pow2: 2,
        pref_pow2: 3
    },
    size: Size {
        raw: 4
    }
}', librustc/ty/layout.rs:783:30
```

<details>
<summary>Complete error details</summary>

```
wesley@endurance:~/code/rust/rust> RUST_BACKTRACE=1 RUSTFLAGS="-Z fuel=rustc=0" ./x.py build --stage 1
Updating only changed submodules
Submodules updated in 0.04 seconds
    Finished dev [unoptimized] target(s) in 0.21s
Building stage0 std artifacts (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
    Finished release [optimized] target(s) in 0.20s
Copying stage0 std from stage0 (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu / x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
Building stage0 test artifacts (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
    Finished release [optimized] target(s) in 0.18s
Copying stage0 test from stage0 (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu / x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
```
